    • Method Detail

      • getEvent

        @RequestMapping(value="/getEvent",
                method=GET)
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.grouper.models.Message> getEvent(@RequestParam(value="eventId",defaultValue="00000000")
                                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String eventId)
        Get an event with the provided eventId from the object store. If the object is not currently in the cache, it will be loaded from DynamoDB.

        -- Request format --

        method: GET

        url: box.grouper.site:8080/getEvent?eventId=00000000

        Parameters:
        eventId - string eventId
        Returns:
        Message(status, description, field, value) status: {200, 400} description: {AWS_GET_SUCCESS, AWS_GET_FAILURE} field: {Event, eventId} value: {JSON Event object, offending eventId}

      • createEvent

        @RequestMapping(value="/createEvent",
                method=POST,
                produces="application/json;charset=UTF-8",
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.grouper.models.Message> createEvent(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               CreateEventRequest request)
        Create an event in DynamoDB with the provided parameters, and add it to the local object store.

        -- Request format --

        method: POST

        url: box.grouper.site:8080/createEvent

        body: {eventName: String, eventDate: String, eventLocation: String, eventDescription: String}

        Parameters:
        request - CreateEventRequest request
        Returns:
        Message(status, description, field, value) status: {200, 400} description: {AWS_PUT_SUCCESS, AWS_PUT_FAILURE} field: {Event, eventId} value: {JSON Event Object, offending eventId}

      • updateEvent

        @RequestMapping(value="/updateEventFields",
                method=POST,
                produces="application/json;charset=UTF-8",
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.grouper.models.Message> updateEvent(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     UpdateEventRequest request)
        Update an existing event with the given eventId, updates remotely (DynamoDB) and locally.

        -- Request format --

        method: POST

        url: box.grouper.site:8080/updateEventFields

        body: {eventId: String, eventName: String, eventDate: String, eventLocation: String, eventDescription: String}

        Parameters:
        request - UpdateEventRequest request
        Returns:
        Message(status, description, field, value) status: {200, 400} description: {AWS_UPDATE_SUCCESS, AWS_UPDATE_FAILURE} field: {Event, eventId} value: {JSON Event Object, offending eventId}

      • deleteGroup

        @RequestMapping(value="/deleteEvent",
                method=DELETE,
                produces="application/json;charset=UTF-8",
                consumes="application/json;charset=UTF-8")
 @ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.ArrayList<com.grouper.models.Message>> deleteGroup(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      DeleteEventRequest request)
        Delete an existing event with the given eventId, both remotely and locally. Deletes groups belonging to the event in question, and removes enrolled users. If this operation results in failure, the id of the offending object will be included in the response payload. This response is ugly, but this request is an abnormal one. This request should NOT be made via the Grouper app. Internal data tool only. If an event host wants their event deleted, they will need to submit a request to Grouper admins.

        -- Request format --

        method: DELETE

        url: box.grouper.site:8080/deleteEvent

        body: {eventId: String, eventGroups: [String], eventUsers: [String]}

        Parameters:
        request - DeleteEventRequest request
        Returns:
        [Message(status, description, field, value)] status: {200, 400} description: {AWS_DELETE_SUCCESS, AWS_DELETE_FAILURE} field: {userId, groupId, eventId} value: {offending userId, offending groupId, offending eventId}
